intro: Pedicularis spicata subsp. bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its elongated bracts that resemble leaves, which are often tinged with red or purple. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. This plant is part of the Orobanchaceae family and is often found in meadows and mountainous areas.
